title: Bug 49536: Accessing a URL returns 200 OK with no content instead of 404 when no webapps are deployed in Tomcat 7
description: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 server that has no webapps deployed, the server returns an HTTP code 200 OK with no content instead of the expected HTTP error 404.
OB: When I start a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps on it and access a URL, the server returns HTTP code 200 OK with an empty response body.
EB: The expected behavior is that when there are no webapps deployed in Tomcat 7, accessing a URL should return an HTTP error 404.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Download http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip
2. Start a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed
3. Access a URL on the Tomcat server
4. Verify that the server returns HTTP code 200 OK with no content instead of an HTTP error 404.
